text: Zinzi Elna Chabangu (born 28 September 1996) is a South African athlete specialising in the triple jump. She won a silver medal at the 2018 African Championships in Asaba with 13.59 metres and a bronze medal at the 2019 African Games with the same result. She's the South African record holder with a jump of 14.02m, this feet happened at Tuks Sports Athletics track March 2020. ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|2013 |rowspan=2|World Youth Championships |rowspan=2|Donetsk, Ukraine | – |Long jump |NM |- |16th (q) |Triple jump |12.36 m |- |rowspan=2|2014 |rowspan=2|World Junior Championships |rowspan=2|Eugene, United States |19th (q) |Long jump |5.95 m |- |22nd (q) |Triple jump |12.84 m |- |rowspan=6|2015 |rowspan=2|African Junior Championships |rowspan=2|Addis Ababa, Ethiopia |12th |Long jump |4.95 m |- |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |Triple jump |13.03 m |- |rowspan=2|Universiade |rowspan=2|Gwangju, South Korea |17th (q) |Long jump |5.87 m |- |20th (q) |Triple jump |12.78 m |- |rowspan=2|African Games |rowspan=2|Brazzaville, Republic of the Congo |7th |Long jump |6.08 m |- |5th |Triple jump |13.00 m |- |rowspan=2|2018 |rowspan=2|African Championships |rowspan=2|Asaba, Nigeria |4th |Long jump |6.14 m |- |bgcolor=silver|2nd |Triple jump |13.59 m |- |rowspan=4|2019 |rowspan=2|Universiade |rowspan=2|Naples, Italy |20th (q) |Long jump |5.97 m |- |7th |Triple jump |13.42 m |- |rowspan=2|African Games |rowspan=2|Rabat, Morocco |4th |Long jump |6.15 m |- |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |Triple jump |13.42 m |} ==References== Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:South African female triple jumpers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2015 African Games Category:African Games competitors for South Africa Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2019 African Games Category:African Games bronze medalists for South Africa Category:African Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Competitors at the 2015 Summer Universiade Category:Competitors at the 2019 Summer Universiade
